definition: to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: We'll be late for the meeting if we stay any longer.
sentences.chinese: 再不走我们开会就要迟到了。

sentences.english: He is an hour late -- He can have been delayed by fog.
sentences.chinese: 他迟到了一小时，可能由于大雾而担搁了。

sentences.english: You came late to class, so you're not seeing the whole picture.
sentences.chinese: 你上学迟到了，以是你没有瞅见工作的全数颠末。

sentences.english: Steven was tardy this morning and alleges that his bus was late.
sentences.chinese: 芬今天早上迟到的说词是公车误点了。

sentences.english: He never got to the office late, like some important officials did, and he never procrastinated on any official duties.
sentences.chinese: 他从来就不像一些大官那样迟到，更不会延误公务。

sentences.english: But there's a bus every ten minutes, and you are over 1 hour late.
sentences.chinese: 但是每十分钟就有一班公车，你迟到一个多钟了。

sentences.english: I oversleep again this morning and was almost late for work.
sentences.chinese: 本日早上又睡过甚了，上班差点迟到。

sentences.english: Ann apologized to her teacher for coming to school late.
sentences.chinese: 安因上学迟到而向老师道歉。

sentences.english: Ambition is alot like love, impatient both of delays and rivals.
sentences.chinese: 壮志雄心和爱情一样，都总是迟到并对对手失去耐心。

sentences.english: No coming late or going home early!
Come on, Wang Lin. We'll be late for the concert.
sentences.chinese: 王林，快点吧，我们去音乐会要迟到了。

sentences.english: You've tried setting your watch several minutes ahead, but you're still late.
sentences.chinese: 你已经把手表调快了几分钟，可你还是迟到了。

sentences.english: TherefOre, the teacher knew why I was late this morning and he apologized to me.
sentences.chinese: 由此老师知道了我今早迟到的原因，他向我道歉。

sentences.english: Some people can be forgiven because of what they do even though they are unpunctual.
sentences.chinese: 一些人因为他们的工作可以被原谅，即便他们迟到。

sentences.english: I have to scat now, I will be late.
sentences.chinese: 我得赶紧走了，我快迟到了。

sentences.english: Jannet : Oh well, better late than never.
sentences.chinese: 是吗，迟到总比没收到强。

definition: to leave early (before the stipulated finishing time)/to retire early (from one's job)
to drag out a lesson/to insist on extending class after the bell
to be absent from work or school
to finish work/to get off work
to go to class/to attend class/to go to teach a class
traffic jam/(of traffic) to get congested
to delay handing over (payment, homework etc)
